#summary Objects used by the NUL language

Class [nul_xpr_object nul.xpr.object].

The objects are the "values" NUL deal with. From simple object like {{{5}}} to complex ones like sets or {{#the attribute "length" of the unknown local "a"}}}, all the questions and knowledge is represented with Objects.

NUL can deal with 'defined' and 'undefined' objects.

The 'defined' objects are the ones we know the structure.
The undefined are the one we can find it out.


= Encountered objects =

 * [nul_obj_undefined nul.obj.undefined] - Undefined objects
  * NulLocal - [nul_obj_local nul.obj.local] - A local unknown value - a name bound to a knowledge.
  * NulIor3 - [nul_obj_ior3 nul.obj.ior3] - Several values that can be taken.
  * NulAttribute - [nul_obj_attribute nul.obj.attribute] - The attribute of another object.
 * [nul_obj_defined nul.obj.defined] - Defined objects
  * NulLitteral - [nul_obj_litteral nul.obj.litteral] - An atomic meaningful given value.
  * NulSets - [nul_obj_pair nul.obj.pair] - A pair of objects (base of sets and lists)
  * NulLambda - [nul_obj_lambda nul.obj.lambda] - A value used to associate an object to another.
  * NulJsSet - [nul_obj_hcSet nul.obj.hcSet] - Some !JavaScript hard-coded sets.
